title: Calories in Coffee with Milk
meta_description: Discover calories in coffee with milk for a standard serving, including macros like fat, carbs, protein, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: 8 oz (240 ml) black brewed coffee with 2 tbsp (30 ml) whole milk added; no sugar, cream, or flavorings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by milk type, coffee strength, serving size, and additions like sugar; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of coffee with 2 tbsp whole milk contains about 20 kcal and 1 g protein.

basis.label: per 1 cup (8 oz coffee + 2 tbsp milk)

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use skim milk instead of whole

faqs.q: How many calories in coffee with milk no sugar?
faqs.a: About 20 kcal for 8 oz coffee with 2 tbsp whole milk.

faqs.q: Is coffee with milk low carb?
faqs.a: Yes, only ~1.5 g carbs from the milk in a standard serving.

faqs.q: What if I use almond milk in coffee?
faqs.a: Unsweetened almond milk adds ~5 kcal and less fat than whole milk.
Negligible, about 2 kcal per cup; milk adds most of the calories.

faqs.q: How does milk type affect calories in coffee?
faqs.a: Whole milk ~18 kcal per 2 tbsp; skim ~10 kcal; plant-based varies by brand.
